snippet: Wednesday morning, drivers who belong to New York City’s largest union of school bus drivers plan to go on strike, the first such action in more than three decades.
abstract: Drivers who belong to New York City’s largest union of school bus drivers go on strike, first such action in more than three decades; at issue is Mayor Michael R Bloomberg’s decision to solicit bids for 1,100 of city’s 7,700 bus routes; winning companies are not required to hire the most experienced unionized drivers, protection that workers have enjoyed for decades and that the union is demanding be included in the bids.

byline.contributor: Matt Flegenheimer and Julie Turkewitz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Wednesday morning, drivers who belong to New York City’s largest union of school bus drivers plan to go on strike, the first such action in more than three decades.

headline.seo: As School Bus Drivers’ Strike Looms, Parents Prepare for Disruptions
